jobs.title: Partnerships Manager (f/m/d)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Upvest is on a mission to make investing as easy as spending money. The company empowers businesses to offer a wide range of investment products and the best experience in the field of capital market investment and retirement planning. Upvest’s Investment API is easy to integrate so that fintechs and enterprises alike can save resources and fully focus on their core business.‍

Upvest is one of the few fintechs in Europe that can provide its B2B clients with the full range of investment opportunities in the areas of principal broking business, proprietary trading, and safe custody business for traditional securities. The company was founded in 2017 by Martin Kassing and currently employs more than 250+ people across Europe. Its latest €100m fundraising round (Series C) was led by Hedosophia and Sapphire Venture, with continued support from existing investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, BlackRock, Earlybird, HV Capital, Motive Ventures, and Notion Capital.

As Upvest enters the next stage of growth, we are looking for an exceptional partner manager. You will be hire #1 into the partnerships team and work directly with our head of partnerships Djurre Hoogeveen owning topics critical to Upvest’s go to market success:

Define the building blocks for partnerships excellence

We aim high at Upvest. Five years ago we embarked on the mission to make investing as easy as spending money. Today we are steadily becoming the backbone of B2C investment products for leading fintechs and global financial institutions. Partnerships are highly strategic for the next phase of our growth journey, as they help i) unlock sales discussions, ii) meet client implementation demands, and iii) create end-to-end investment solution needs.

It will be your exciting task to design and improve a scalable framework for partner onboarding and management. This involves developing and standardising compelling partner touchpoints and interaction frameworks to bring our partner ecosystem to the next level. Additionally, you will create and implement the playbooks and systems that will make it simple for partners to work with us.

Build our partnerships ecosystem

We aim to create the #1 partner ecosystem in the investment infrastructure space. This means teaming up with the top companies across the different partner types, from strategy consultants and systems integrators to fund issuers and solutions providers that extend our product capabilities. We will prove early success in DACH (and the UK) as the partnerships ecosystem expands across Europe.

With your approachable and productive mindset, you will grow and further establish our partnership network. You will proactively identify and qualify high impact partners, define our value proposition for different partner types, and develop strong relationships with key stakeholders at priority partner organizations. In addition, you will lead the negotiation of cooperation agreements with our partners.

Executing the partnerships strategy

As a key member of our growing team, you will play a pivotal role in bringing the partnership strategy to life. With your strong execution skills, diligence, and structured approach you will implement the partnership strategy and drive the day-to-day. As the key counterpart to our partners, you will be responsible for delivering the partner journey from onboarding and enablement to quarterly goal setting and technical integrations. In addition, you will lead the communication to the market on our partnership success stories - in collaboration with the Marketing team.

What you'll bring:

  • Experience: You have 2-5 years of experience in consulting / investment banking / equity investing and/or partnerships related roles. You are just as comfortable doing groundwork (research, outreach, setting up processes) as you are engaging with strategic topics and building relationships with senior leaders.

  • Industry exposure: You have a strong interest in investments, securities trading, and software-/infrastructure-as-a-service products (e.g., BaaS).

  • Methodologies & processes: You have hands-on experience in standardizing and optimizing sales-related processes.

  • Project management: You proactively drive complex projects to successful outcomes while making execution efficient and straightforward for others.

  • Mindset: You are eager to learn, highly productive, approach challenges in a data-driven manner, and solve problems with a bias to action and attention to detail.

  • Location: Preference for candidates located in Berlin, fluent in English and German (written and verbal).

Why Upvest?

  • We're working on solving a hard problem: fixing the European securities financial infrastructure that empowers more people to be able to invest. You have the opportunity to contribute to this change.

  • We invest in your growth with a dedicated development budget and plenty of opportunities to advance in your role.

  • We take hiring seriously with a strong focus on keeping a high bar when interviewing (equally important is that we hire decent people, who are passionate about their craft and helping us achieve our shared mission).

  • While we're not quite fully-remote, we are committed to being a flexible employer, as we understand you don't have to be in the office to do your best work.

  • We live a culture of empowerment, trust (that we hire the best people and get out of their way) and openness (there's a greater advantage in sharing information than keeping it to ourselves).

Our Values:

  • Make it easy for others. Team over Egos.

  • Own the outcome. Progress over Perfection.

  • Rise to the challenge. Growth over Comfort.

  • Tell the story. Clarity over Ambiguity.

If you are a self-starter with experience in and a passion for building and scaling revenue-generating functions, we’d love to hear from you.

Upvest is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees

jobs.title: Principal/ Senior (Enterprise) Launch Manager (f/m/d)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Upvest, we're on a mission to make investing as easy as spending money. We are building the first European Investment API that empowers businesses to offer seamless investment. experiences to their users.

Upvest is a well-funded, fast-growing FinTech with a diverse team of over 250 people from 70+ nationalities working across our hubs in Berlin, Tallinn, and London. Our latest €100m fundraising round (Series C) was led by Hedosophia and Sapphire Venture, with continued support from existing investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, BlackRock, Earlybird, HV Capital, Motive Ventures, and Notion Capital.

We currently employ 250+ people across Europe with our headquarters based in Berlin, Germany, and hubs in Tallinn, Estonia, and London, UK.

How we Upvest in you*:

  • Work with experts: Solving complex problems and fixing the European securities financial infrastructure that empowers more people to be able to invest by using cutting-edge technologies.

  • Flexible work environment: Work from any of our hubs in Berlin, London or Tallinn hybrid or remotely across Europe, depending on the role.

  • Professional development: Access an annual budget of €1,500 for personal and professional training to master your craft.

  • Wellbeing: Recharge with 30 days of annual leave and maintain a healthy lifestyle with sports benefits. Access confidential professional coaching and enjoy the flexibility to work remotely abroad for up to 183 days a year.

  • Compensation and equity: We believe that all Upvengers contribute to our success and deserve a competitive, above-market salary and a participation in our employee equity program.

  • Team celebrations: Participate in company-wide events, such as UpFest, dinners, offsites and our Holiday party, to connect with colleagues and celebrate our achievements.

Your Impact:

  • As Principal Launch Manager, you’ll lead Upvest’s most complex, high-stakes launches with established banks in Germany and across Europe. You’ll own end-to-end delivery for full launch programs - spanning scoping, implementation, and (where possible) migration - while serving as the executive-facing driver of the project. Additionally, you will support / drive asset migrations from incumbent custodians to Upvest, ensuring continuity of service, data integrity, and zero-defect go-lives.

  • You are the “spider in the web”: synthesizing deep product knowledge with operational excellence, running steering committees with Upvest and client executives, and aligning legal, compliance, and technology streams. You’ll set the bar for how Upvest launches complex banking clients, help shape our playbooks, and mentor Launch Managers across the portfolio.

What you’ll do:

  • Own bank-grade programs end-to-end - Upvest’s most complex and exciting projects!

  • Support or own (depending on experience) custody asset migrations (e.g. equities, ETFs, Mutual Funds etc.) from the client’s previous custodian to Upvest

  • Ensure all projects are meticulously planned, executed, and tested

  • Create first-class, repeatable enterprise client launch and migration experiences: Lead and standardize securities integration and migration projects, enabling clients to build investment products on our API

  • Drive day-to-day execution with Engineering, Product, Operations, and Compliance - removing blockers, negotiate trade-offs, and keep scope, timeline and risk in balance

  • Set new standards in client collaboration and communication

  • Run steering sessions with senior stakeholders at established banks. Surface options with clear implications, secure decisions, and maintain a crisp narrative of progress and risk

  • Build trusted client relationships and foster cross-functional collaboration with a partnership mindset. Your pragmatic leadership style ensures successful integrations, motivates teams, and aligns client needs with our business goals

What you bring:

  • Proven track record leading complex, multi-entity programs for tier-1 banks or large financial institutions—ideally covering custody, brokerage, post-trade, or securities operations

  • Ideally experience in management consulting

  • Executive communication, decision-log discipline, and calm leadership under pressure

  • Expert in end-to-end project management: Proven ability to design, plan, and execute large-scale projects

  • Superb project and communication skills, with a hands-on attitude

  • A client-first mindset and a pragmatic approach to solving problems

  • A willingness to dive into the deep end, be challenged and learn at a rapid pace

  • Risk Management focus - Ability to identify risks associated with migrations and implement effective mitigation strategies

  • Capable of defining and aligning technical and business requirements for seamless migration processes

  • Experience in managing the custody transfer of financial instruments, like equities, ETFs and mutual funds

  • Passionate about improving tools and processes

  • You are proactive in coming up with an informed hypothesis, planning with foresight, and addressing questions or issues early

  • You are fluent in English and German (both written and verbal)

Your plus would be:

  • Strong domain fluency across post-trade and custody (settlement, corporate actions, reconciliations, tax/cost basis, reporting) and familiarity with standards (e.g., SWIFT MT/MX/ISO 20022).

  • Deep migrations experience: in-specie/on-book transfers, large-scale data & asset moves, reconciliation at scale, and structured cutovers with dry-runs and rollback.

  • Regulatory and risk acumen (e.g., MiFID II, CSDR, AML/KYC, outsourcing guidelines) and the ability to embed controls and evidence into the delivery plan.

  • Skilled in handling migrations across a range of system architectures, from legacy platforms to modern APIs, ensuring a flexible and efficient approach to integration.

  • Oversight in managing post-migration reconciliation to guarantee consistency across systems.

Our Values:

  • Make it easy for others. Team over Egos.

  • Own the outcome. Progress over Perfection.

  • Rise to the challenge. Growth over Comfort.

  • Tell the story. Clarity over Ambiguity.

Our Commitment to Belonging

At Upvest we’re dedicated to building an inclusive environment where every Upvenger feels a true sense of belonging and is empowered to do their best work. We are a proud equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability. Your unique path is what we value.

* These benefits apply if you will be hired in Germany, Estonia or the UK. If you live elsewhere within Europe, some of the benefits might be slightly different.

Working closely with our Head of Strategy & Chief of Staff and our executive and senior management teams, you’ll ensure seamless business operations. You will gain wide exposure across our business, contributing to high-impact projects alongside senior leadership.

It is a great opportunity if you aspire to grow professionally and personally.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Upvest, we're on a mission to make investing as easy as spending money. We are building the first European Investment API that empowers businesses to offer seamless investment experiences to their users.

Upvest is a well-funded, fast-growing FinTech with a diverse team of over 250 people from 70+ nationalities working across our hubs in Berlin, Tallinn, and London. Our latest €100m fundraising round (Series C) was led by Hedosophia and Sapphire Venture, with continued support from existing investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, BlackRock, Earlybird, HV Capital, Motive Ventures, and Notion Capital.

We currently employ 250+ people across Europe with our headquarters based in Berlin, Germany, and hubs in Tallinn, Estonia, and London, UK.

How we Upvest in you*:

  • Work with experts: Solving complex problems and fixing the European securities financial infrastructure that empowers more people to be able to invest by using cutting-edge technologies.

  • Professional development: Access an annual budget of €1,500 for personal and professional training to master your craft.

  • Wellbeing: Recharge with 30 days of annual leave and maintain a healthy lifestyle with sports benefits. Access confidential professional coaching and enjoy the flexibility to work remotely abroad for up to 183 days a year.

  • Compensation and equity: We believe that all Upvengers contribute to our success and deserve a competitive, above-market salary and a participation in our employee equity program.

  • Team celebrations: Participate in company-wide events, such as UpFest, dinners, offsites and our Holiday party, to connect with colleagues and celebrate our achievements.

Your Impact:

  • We are a dedicated security team of 9 working to ensure we strictly follow the principles of secure-by-design, zero trust, and the principle of least privilege. We have the luxury of building a security function in a greenfield environment, which means we operate at the cutting edge with modern best practices. We are always seeking out and open to new and novel ways to improve the security posture of our company.

  • Security isn’t just about our team though, at Upvest it’s part of the culture. The team itself is one of the oldest within (our young) company, which should show you how it’s always been a central tenet of how Upvest defines itself. Within the security team you will have a large view of the whole organisation and work closely with every department.

What you’ll do:

  • Act as a security subject matter expert for the entire company, operating across multiple disciplines from application and cloud security to GRC. While your work will be broad, your primary focus will be on partnering with our Product Engineering teams to embed a "secure by default" mindset

  • Work with our team and Product and Engineering to perform detailed security architecture reviews of new functionality (facilitating threat modeling is a plus)

  • Field security questions and requests with confidence and an aim to mentor and educate

  • Scale the security team by finding areas where security tasks can be automated (and improved)

  • Be comfortable working with the cloud (specifically Google Cloud is a plus) and how to tackle its security challenges

  • Ensure that across the product and cloud we have the technical measures in place to continue meeting our own standards, obligations, regulations and certifications (ISO27001, ISAE3402 Type 2, DORA, etc)

  • Drive high-impact initiatives and be a present security advocate

What you bring:

  • A real passion for information security, staying abreast of developments in the field, and a desire for knowledge sharing and educating others

  • Experience working in the field of Cyber Security and a degree in a related field

  • A strong foundation in cybersecurity principles and an understanding of frameworks and methodologies, including MITRE ATT&CK, Cyber Kill Chain, incident response frameworks (NIST, SANS), and threat hunting techniques

  • Experience with being on the security side of an SSDLC; i.e. improving it, socialising it, and implementing it

  • Experience with threat modeling, or security reviews

  • Excellent communication skills and empathy, security is a complex topic which you have to be able to explain to audiences of various levels of previous exposure or learning

Your plus would be:

  • Relevant cloud experience (familiarity with Google Cloud)

  • Passion for DevSecOps

  • Experience with Go

  • Comfortable working with EDR and SIEM solutions

  • Ideally you will be based in Berlin. If you're currently located elsewhere but would like to move, we’re happy to support your relocation

Our values:

  • Make it easy for others. Team over Egos.

  • Own the outcome. Progress over Perfection.

  • Rise to the challenge. Growth over Comfort.

  • Tell the story. Clarity over Ambiguity.

Our Commitment to Belonging

At Upvest we’re dedicated to building an inclusive environment where every Upvenger feels a true sense of belonging and is empowered to do their best work. We are a proud equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability. Your unique path is what we value.

* These benefits apply if you will be hired in Germany, Estonia or the UK. If you live elsewhere within Europe, some of the benefits might be slightly different.

You will lead the Brokerage Tribe, which comprises four teams. These teams are responsible for critical domains such as Orders, Trading Partner integrations, Position, and Wealth Management, all of which are essential for Upvest’s Investment API.

The Brokerage Tribe plays a crucial role in the Investment API Platform, overseeing a wide range of user journey aspects. This includes the placement and management of individual trading orders, the maintenance of corresponding securities and cash positions, and the administration of the complete universe of instruments available for trading on Upvest.

Furthermore, the Tribe is responsible for managing price data for both internal and external consumers, integrating with various external trading partners, and handling the settlement flows of executed trades. Beyond individual trading order infrastructure, the Tribe also delivers Wealth Management products, such as Investment Portfolios and Saving Plans.

  • Engage with internal and client stakeholders, including Product Engineering Teams, the Product Department, and the Operations Department, to ensure superior product and build quality, and to shape priorities, scopes, and staging of new products.

  • Develop expertise in the Brokerage domain, acquiring a profound understanding of client use cases and needs.

  • Collaborate closely with Product Engineering Teams to enable their autonomy while simultaneously enhancing efficiency through a broader perspective and cross-team coordination.

  • Mentor and foster the growth of future Engineering leaders, leaving a lasting imprint on the organisation.

  • Collaborate as a member of the Engineering Leadership team, contributing to various department-wide and organization-wide initiatives.

  • Experience in leading and growing larger engineering teams in a technical leadership capacity.

  • Prior experience within the Fintech domain.

  • Strong technical expertise and hands-on experience in developing highly scalable, distributed, asynchronous, and resilient applications.

  • Strong work ethic and principles such as pragmatism.

  • A security-focused mindset and high sense of taking ownership.

At Upvest, we're on a mission to make investing as easy as spending money. We are building the first European Investment API that empowers businesses to offer seamless investment. experiences to their users.

Upvest is a well-funded, fast-growing FinTech with a diverse team of over 250 people from 70+ nationalities working across our hubs in Berlin, Tallinn, and London. Our latest €100m fundraising round (Series C) was led by Hedosophia and Sapphire Venture, with continued support from existing investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, BlackRock, Earlybird, HV Capital, Motive Ventures, and Notion Capital.

Teams Mission

The Growth team at Upvest is driving our go-to-market activities and is responsible for Upvest's topline. Our mission is to become the Investment-as-a-Service category leader for Europe's leading brokers, banks, wealth managers, and non-financial platforms. We're honoured to work with some of Europe's most influential brands in a fast-moving and expanding market already and are just getting started. All our team efforts are centred around our clients and give you the opportunity to work on your own projects. Working in the Growth team combines impactful work with a relaxed and fun atmosphere. We have established strong practices around feedback, team health, and social events.

How We Upvest In You?

  • We're working on solving a hard problem: fixing the European securities financial infrastructure that empowers more people to be able to invest. You have the opportunity to contribute to this change.

  • We invest in you. From access to a personal coach, development budget and plenty of opportunities to grow in your role.

  • We take hiring seriously with a strong focus on keeping a high bar when interviewing (equally important is that we hire decent people, who are passionate about their craft and helping us achieve our shared mission).

  • We live in a culture of empowerment, trust (that we hire the best people and get out of their way) and openness (there's a greater advantage in sharing information than keeping it to ourselves).

What You’ll Do

Contribute to the evolution of our Business Development by bringing your knowledge and passion to support our go-to-market in the upcoming months, and potentially beyond:

  • Strategize and Innovate: Contribute to the development of dynamic outbound strategies and craft meaningful pitches that captivate potential customers, driving our business growth.

  • Optimize Sales Performance: Utilize data-driven analyses to design and implement initiatives that enhance the efficiency and productivity of our sales team, ensuring we focus on the right things in our high-growth phase.

  • Collaborate Across Departments: Engage in cross-functional collaboration, working closely with both external stakeholders (clients, partners, etc.) and internal teams (product, finance, legal, etc.) to support and align strategic objectives.

  • Lead Market Research Efforts: Conduct independent market research to uncover, gather, manage, and analyze trends and business opportunities, providing valuable insights that influence our strategic direction.

  • Previous work experience: From related, fast-paced work environments in the financial industry is a plus

What you’ll bring:

  • Availability for a 4–6 month internship

  • Eagerness to learn and a strong passion for the Fintech industry

  • Have previous work experience in fast-paced or related work environments

  • Experience in customer-centric sales processes and client communication

  • Enrollment in or recent completion of a degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related field

  • Fluency in English, both written and spoken

  • A love for challenges and a strong sense of responsibility

  • Are eligible to work in Germany and willing to relocate to Berlin

Our Values:

  • Make it easy for others. Team over Egos.

  • Own the outcome. Progress over Perfection.

  • Rise to the challenge. Growth over Comfort.

  • Tell the story. Clarity over Ambiguity.

Our Commitment to Belonging

At Upvest we’re dedicated to building an inclusive environment where every Upvenger feels a true sense of belonging and is empowered to do their best work. We are a proud equal opportunity employer.   • Work with experts: Solving complex problems and fixing the European securities financial infrastructure that empowers more people to be able to invest by using cutting-edge technologies.

  • Flexible work environment: Work from any of our hubs in Berlin, London or Tallinn hybrid or remotely across Europe, depending on the role.

  • Professional development: Access an annual budget of €1,500 for personal and professional training to master your craft.

  • Wellbeing: Recharge with 30 days of annual leave and maintain a healthy lifestyle with sports benefits. Access confidential professional coaching and enjoy the flexibility to work remotely abroad for up to 183 days a year.

  • Compensation and equity: We believe that all Upvengers contribute to our success and deserve a competitive, above-market salary and a participation in our employee equity program.

  • Team celebrations: Participate in company-wide events, such as UpFest, dinners, offsites and our Holiday party, to connect with colleagues and celebrate our achievements.

Your Impact:

  • Set the Account Management gold-standard at Upvest
    Upvest is becoming the category leader in investment infrastructure, defining a new standard in client success and long-term satisfaction. To enable this vision, you establish, lead, and continuously refine a comprehensive Account Management function.

    Your primary mission is to build and scale the function for enterprise clients: introducing proven Enterprise Account Management and Client Success practices, structuring teams for impact, and instilling habits that drive repeatable excellence. You bring a hands-on attitude and deep experience in leading teams that serve enterprise clients in the fintech sector.

    With a strong commercial mindset, you identify upsell and expansion opportunities and ensure that growth within existing accounts is captured systematically. You operate with a KPI-driven approach with clear eye on NRR, GRR and CSATs. By implementing the right playbook and leveraging analytics, you create scalable, measurable impact while delivering consistent “wow” moments to our clients.

    You act as an ambassador of Upvest, bringing the company’s expertise, ecosystem capabilities, and culture to our clients. You cultivate and maintain strong, trust-based relationships with enterprise fintechs and incumbent banks alike, with a focus on enabling scalable success.

  • 6+ years of leadership experience in Account Management or Customer Success teams in the fintech/ banking industry in a B2B context, ideally with SaaS/API-based products

  • Experience in investment (infrastructure) is a strong plus

  • Proven success managing enterprise-level clients and 7-figure+ accounts, navigating complex, multi-stakeholder environments

  • Support secure data sharing processes with partners and clients, ensuring confidentiality and compliance throughout all interactions

  • Define and enforce common API governance practices to ensure consistency, security, and compliance across all public-facing APIs

  • Drive discovery and design of valuable cross-cutting core services improving our API platform offering

  • Interact with internal and client stakeholders (Product Engineering Teams, Platform Engineers, and Customer Support) to ensure great product and build quality

  • Experience in leading and growing engineering teams in a technical leadership position

  • Prior experience with message brokers such as Kafka

  • Go proficiency or a strong willingness to learn

  • Strong work ethic and principles such as pragmatism

  • A focus on quality, extensibility, regression and E2E testing

  • Practical experience with Docker and CI/CD 

  • Prior experience with SQL databases such as PostgreSQL

  • A security-focused mindset

  • The eagerness to learn and explore new technologies

  • A high sense of taking ownership

  • Excitement to work in a fast-paced and dynamic startup environment
